TextEng: Goodbye.
What happened here, Riisi?
So, Master Drogan's annoying familiar, Riisi, survived.
Text: 그래, 드로건 스승님의 짜증나는 사역마 리시가 살아남았군.

TextEng: Hello Riisi, how are you?
Drogan was wounded and will likely die.
Text: 드로건 스승님이 부상당하셨고 아마 돌아가실 거야.

TextEng: <StartCheck>[Persuade - Lie]</Start> Master Drogan is fine.
Master Drogan was poisoned by the kobolds.
I want to ask you some questions.
Text: 몇 가지 물어보고 싶은 게 있어.

TextEng: I have no more questions.
What is in the laboratory?
I don't care about your items.
I will take the items to Drogan.
Text: 그 물건들은 내가 드로건 스승님께 가져다드릴게.

TextEng: <StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Give the items to me.
Give me the items or I'll strangle you.
Text: 물건들을 넘겨. 안 그러면 목을 졸라버릴 거야.

TextEng: Fine, ask me your riddles, stupid faerie dragon.
Text: 좋아, 수수께끼를 내봐, 멍청한 요정 용아.

TextEng: I hate riddles.
Alright, ask me your riddles then.
Ask me your riddles.
You help me, or your life ends now!
Text: 날 도와. 안 그러면 지금 당장 목숨이 끝나!

TextEng: If you give me what I want, then yes.
I don't want to hurt you, but you must take this seriously, Riisi.
Text: 널 해치고 싶지 않지만, 이건 진지하게 받아들여야 해, 리시.

TextEng: Yes, just get on with it.
No, please, wait! Master Drogan desperately needs our help!
Text: 아니, 제발 기다려! 드로건 스승님께 우리 도움이 절실해!

TextEng: <StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Riisi, you are just too smart for me. Please give me another chance.
Text: <StartCheck>[설득]</Start> 리시, 넌 나한테 너무 똑똑해. 제발 한 번 더 기회를 줘.

TextEng: I don't know.
I am guilty.
I am innocent.
I will be hanged.
Just get on with it.
Yes.
Sixteen.
Twelve.
Ten.
Eight.
Six.
Four.
I will be drowned.
If you ask me one more riddle, I'll end your irritating little life!
Text: 수수께끼 하나만 더 내면, 네 짜증나는 작은 목숨을 끝내버릴 거야!

TextEng: <StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> This isn't going well. Riisi, could you please just trust me?
Text: <StartCheck>[설득]</Start> 이거 잘 안 되고 있어. 리시, 그냥 날 믿어줄 수 없어?

TextEng: I love riddles. Please, continue.
Yes, I will try it.
A little dirt disrupted Drogan's protective magic?
Text: 약간의 흙이 드로건 스승님의 보호 마법을 방해했다고?

TextEng: What did that do?
That is what I asked you in the first place!
Yes, please tell me.
How do I get into the laboratory?
You let me in, or I will wring your leathery little neck!
Text: 날 들여보내, 안 그러면 네 가죽 같은 작은 목을 비틀어버릴 거야!

TextEng: <StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Surely you can trust me to go in.
Text: <StartCheck>[설득]</Start> 내가 들어가도 될 정도로 날 믿을 수 있잖아.

TextEng: I think you are confused, fair creature.
Text: 네가 착각하는 것 같은데, 아름다운 생명체야.

TextEng: Stupid fairie dragon, who are you calling a kobold?
What are you talking about?
A little dirt disrupted Drogan's protective magic?
Text: 약간의 흙이 드로건 스승님의 보호 마법을 방해했다고?

TextEng: What did that do?
Why can't I go in?
Text: 왜 내가 들어갈 수 없는 거야?

TextEng: Can you tell me exactly what the kobolds did?
Text: 코볼트들이 정확히 뭘 했는지 말해줄 수 있어?

TextEng: And in this dream, is there a knight in shining armor, who speaks poetry to you?
Text: 그리고 그 꿈에는, 네게 시를 읊어주는 빛나는 갑옷의 기사가 있어?

TextEng: Do your dreams have naked nymphs and dryads too?
Text: 네 꿈에는 벌거벗은 님프랑 드라이어드도 나와?

TextEng: No, I don't have stupid dreams like that. Now, get on with it.
Text: 아니, 난 그런 멍청한 꿈 안 꿔. 이제 본론으로 가.

TextEng: Get to the story.
Yes, but please get to what happened.
Text: 응, 근데 무슨 일이 있었는지 말해줘.

TextEng: A little dirt disrupted Drogan's protective magic?
Text: 약간의 흙이 드로건 스승님의 보호 마법을 방해했다고?

TextEng: What did that do?
What did you do when the kobolds crossed the barrier?
Text: 코볼트들이 결계를 넘었을 때 넌 뭘 했어?

TextEng: Dorna is right. Do you have a single, useful thing to say, Riisi?
Text: 도르나 말이 맞아. 리시, 유용한 말 하나라도 있어?

TextEng: Dorna, Riisi is trying to be helpful, leave her alone.
Text: 도르나, 리시는 도우려고 하는 거야, 그냥 내버려 둬.

TextEng: Alright, that will be enough out of both of you.
Xanos is right. Do you have a single, useful thing to say, Riisi?
Text: 자노스 말이 맞아. 리시, 유용한 말 하나라도 있어?

TextEng: Xanos, Riisi is trying to be helpful, leave her alone.
Text: 자노스, 리시는 도우려고 하는 거야, 그냥 내버려 둬.

TextEng: Alright, that will be enough out of both of you.
I hate riddles.
Kobolds are fun to kill. I wonder if faerie dragons are fun to kill too?
Text: 코볼트는 죽이면 재밌지. 요정 용도 죽이면 재밌을까?

TextEng: Tell me your riddle.
I don't know.
No.
Yes.
